reviews.review_msg: Lectures were pre-recorded and tutorials were in person, class was pretty easy and really interesting

terrible time management, always goes over time without covering everything and without giving a break. assigns sometimes hundreds of pages of readings a week, which are almost necessary because her lectures are full of her rambling. unclear grading with no formal rubrics.

seems like a super nice lady, but not the best instructor.
dont do it
i did okay because i was interested in the topic, had some background knowledge and had fun reading, but it was hard for an introductory course

Brenda seems like the nicest person but IS302 was the most boring class I have taken at SFU. She assigns 100-120 pages of readings each week. There are weekly discussions and a paper and final exam. Seems like a nice person, but the amount of readings required for one class is insane.

For an online course during covid it was well organized. Recorded lectures were clear and informative but they could be dry sometimes. Her slides are detailed and very helpful to study for exams. The final exam was an essay where you have to discuss some of the readings. Marking was fair. Overall I got a lot out of the class and would take again.

Would not recommend it as an elective. Too many unnecessary readings. Tutorial and participation are mandatory. Very boring if you have no interest in the topics. If you enjoy reading/writing and are good at memorizing, go for it!

DO NOT TAKE THIS IF YOUR NEW TO UNI OR WANT AN ELECTIVE!!! i had no idea what she was talking about almost every lecture, and not because i didn't do the readings. the language of this class is so unknown. if you arent interested in these topics or do not have background knowledge i would definitely not take this class!!! hard marker too

As a human being, Brenda is absolutely fantastic. I absolutely adored her, she answered so many questions and was so considerate despite the amount of students she had. As a professor I'm not too sure.. I got a high grade but it was the hardest intro course ever. Lot's of hard tests for low % worth and most of which are hidden deep inside readings.

Tutorials are useful and min-assignments are easy. Lectures are boring and long but content is understandable. Her marking for the Final Paper and Tests is stupid, TA told me my writing and work had improved by the proff chose to mark harder. How does our grade demonstrate our learning if the difficulty you choose to mark is random and vague?
Great prof!

Brenda is very nice but grading seems very inconsistent; felt unfair as it feels she marks off how she would do it rather than the rubric provided. Very sweet professor and interesting content but due to marking I would not take this again with Brenda as my Prof (or TA).

Brenda is awesome. She's very knowledgeable and makes you think about topics from different perspectives. She's also passionate about what she teaches. Take her tutorial if you can, the discussions were always interesting and you can tell she really cares about students.

Brenda is a great prof. The material is very interesting and I learned ALOT! Although, readings are often long and somewhat unecessary to do well in this class (as long as you skim through the main readings before tutorial), and she speaks very slow in lecture videos. If you have ADHD and a hard time focussing like me, this class may not be for you

Prof Lyshaug is a very caring and knowledgable prof. The topics discussed in this class are very interesting and I learned ALOT from this class! Although, the readings are long and dense and somewhat unecessary. She speaks very slow and lectures can be boring. If you have ADHD and a hard time focussing like me, this class may not be for you.
Lectures were interesting and she was very accommodating and kind.
My favorite class this semester. Its a good introduction for global issues.
It's pretty boring. Would not take IS again, but the prof is not too bad.

I loved this class and learned a lot. Brenda is great and makes the course interesting. She's super helpful with questions and gives clear instructions on assignments. Midterm time limit was too short, final was better. Marking was fair but be prepared to work for a really good grade. It's worth it.
Eye opening class on relevant topics. Dr. Lyshaug is fantastic. She makes everything clear and is really helpful with questions.
Poorly organized class; does not mark assignments timely; use poor academic literatures for course readings; poor teaching

Brenda is awesome! She has good material on her lecture slides to better clarify the content of the readings! The class is interesting as well as the material! She is very caring and likes to be able to help whoever she can as well as is someone who you can approach whenever without feeling scared! Her passion adds to the class! Great professor!

Brenda is very approachable and knowledgable. She gives A LOT of info about the exams, so its possible to really prepare and do well. I wouldn't say they're easy, but theyre not hard if you do the work. She's slow in email but really helpful in person so definitely go to her office hours. Overall a great class and super interesting.
Would not recommend this class with her for a first year. Lecture material was simple but her testing was unfair and marked papers difficulty.

Brenda is very passionate about this course but she fails to make it an introduction. If you don't have much background knowledge of this, you will not succeed. She rambles as well and gets through 3 slides but expects you to know more and prepare with the slides for the exams. Get ready to learn everything through your tutorials
She rambles on for too long and won't cover all of the promised content per session as a result of talking too much on one topic.
She's extremely nice and caring but she takes her time marking assignments. Although, the feedback given is extremely helpful and detailed.

Brenda is a knowledgeable prof but her format of the class lectures and the group project needs a lot of improvement. The group project was too time consuming, unorganized and it was only 15% of our grade. Her TA this semester (fall 2019) is a really unreasonable hard marker, hopefully its not the same TA next sem or else GOOD LUCK.
Brenda does tend to rant sometimes BUT the content of the course is clear. She is very passionate, approachable and helpful. You also don't need to buy any text book.

Absolutely one of the top 3 profs I've ever had. She's clear with what she wants from you, her lectures go over the reading super well so if you miss any readings it's easy to follow along, very helpful, understanding, I have no complaints except she does assign a lot of reading.

I took this class because I heard many great things and that it made people want to major is International Studies. Unfortunately, I dont have a ton of background info in this course and it is definitely needed or you might be a little lost. She rambles a lot and gets through about 3 slides every lecture. But shes extremely passionate and kind

The lectures are not the most interesting, they are almost word for word the same as the readings. But you will learn the concepts and she is accessible outside of class. Her marking can be a bit tough- if you dont use the specific language she uses on her slides she will mark it wrong.

Brenda is the greatest of all time; she is the reason that I am majoring in International Studies. Her lectures are well organized, the readings she chooses are great, and, most importantly, she gives detailed instructions and feedback. I highly recommend her class to anyone interested in politics or world affairs.

She was good in 101, she was GREAT in 200. Great lecturer, great material, great readings, great textbook, great assignments. My only criticism is that her exams demand QUITE A LOT in VERY LITTLE TIME, but she gives you so much info to prepare for them (especially the final exam). She does ramble during her lectures, but it's really interesting.

Amazing professor. AMAZING WOMAN! Really cares about her students and is reasonable with deadlines. Will do the most to help her students succeed. Exams are fair and reflect the lectures and textbook. Papers are interesting and fairly marked. Available for help and responds to emails quickly. Love her <3 one of the best IS profs at SFU

Brenda was an absolutely amazing prof. You could tell that she was very passionate about what she was teaching. All of her exams were fair, and while there was a lot of reading, they were always interesting topics. Her lectures were sometimes hard to follow, but she adjusted her lecture notes to match what she ended up covering. Would take again!

Knows her stuff & explains it well, though she tends to ramble (it's hard to stay focused all lecture). WAY too much reading for a 100-level course, but it's worth reading. PowerPoints fluctuate in the amount of info on them, so take notes of what she's saying. Interesting writing assignments. Fair tests but in WAY TOO LITTLE TIME. Engaged & caring

Very understanding prof. The lecture SLIDES (which are tested on exams) are easy to follow, but Brenda tends to ramble. Or something that can be said in 1 minute, she explains in 3 minutes. You can tell she really wants to give us a full picture, but not all perspectives are necessary for an intro class. I wish speeches were less convoluted!

Brenda is nice. Has an equal distribution of grading. But,she talks a lot, rambles A LOT. Don't t take 101 unless u know some of the stuff already, otherwise ur gonna be clueless. Doesn't explain concepts, figure out on ur own. doesn't feel like an intro class. LOTS OF READING, tough grading sometimes! if u try somewhat you could do fine. Goodluck

Brenda is very kind but tends to get very off topic. Her lectures are quite boring although the material is quite interesting. She's an easy marker and she is very lenient too. Most of her tests are within her lecture slides, so it is not that difficult. Overall, she is fair and nice but needs to be more intriguing.

She knows her content very well and knows how to deliver it well too. The readings are too many but very interesting and if you take her tutorials you're good to go. Just do as she says and read like a few paragraphs of each reading and you'll have enough to discuss as well as be in her good books!

It was an interested semester ! The class discussions led by Brenda were insightful . She explains the assigned ready very throughly. Knows the subject really well, very informative . Fair markings on paper and mid term

Professor Lyshaug is an excellent instructor! Her lectures are thorough and insightful and she is very supportive of students. This course gives students an excellent theoretical background. Overall, fantastic course!

Brenda was a wonderful prof who is very knowledgeable about the course material and passionate about what she does. The only thing is that she assigned so many readings, and it's crazy! 350 pages a week on top of other classes is ridiculous! So that was the only downside. Otherwise she is really great.

Brenda's an excellent prof. Her lecturing style detailed, informative and knowledgeable. Her feedback on writing assignments is in-depth and she really wants to help you improve your writing, which is important for this capstone writing course. Quirky in an endearing way, because you can tell she really cares for us students and our success.

Brenda was a great prof! Always had great lecture slides, although she did get a bit lost sometimes. She was very willing to help and always clearly outlined what she wanted in our papers, making them easy to write. Would definitely recommend taking one of her classes.

Brenda is the nicest prof I have ever had. She is super accessible, she answers all of her emails and responds elaborately to them, always makes sure you understand everything. Her tests are fair, and essays are broad enough for you to understand and show your capabilities. Super interesting lectures, good speaker, is passionate about the material

Seems very unsure of herself, seems as if she doesn't want to be there, has us read a lot of questionable readings (not for the sake of discussion, just because), very inconsistent and unclear, and even had us include the word count on our final (which was all written, we had to count every word). I would not recommend her unless you have no choice

She was very caring and fair. She encouraged questions and discussion. The exams were pretty straight forward, however they always involved a catch of having little time to write or having a include a word limit and having to include a word count. Overall I would definitely take a class with Brenda again.
A good prof. She's easy to talk to if you have questions. She was really helpful with my essay and answered questions on email. Assigns too much reading though.

You don'd need to show up to lectures  because she basically just repeats everything it says in the textbook. VERY specific in what she is looking for when marking, her TAs are more helpful and nicer than she is. doesn't seem as though she knows what shes talking about, drags on random points and goes on tangents a lot.

I thought Brenda was a fantastic prof! She encourages class discussion and her lectures are easy to follow. The midterm wasn't too difficult, but only 50min with two short answers and an essay. The term paper was pretty straightforward but very long. Lectures towards the end of semester got progressively less interesting, but still a soild class!

Widely considered one of the best sessional instructors at SFU for a reason. Quirky & technologically impaired but smart, extremely dedicated, knowledgeable and thorough in everything she does. Great lectures, has a unique way of imparting valuable info and a logical grading scheme. Put in the work and get the grades you deserve. Loved her class.

Brenda is the best Poli Sci prof at SFU. Sometimes the material can get boring and her lectures are very dense, but very informative, exams are based on the readings. The essay asks you to use theory from the class to analyze a case, and she marks based on your understanding not your writing skills. Take good notes and you will do well

Brenda does not have powerpoints, but delivers her lectures in a way that you get the info you need for the papertests. While the readings are important, she essentially tells you what they are about, therefore actually reading the readings is not necessary. She also gives you the essay Q for the midterm and final, which is worth 70% of the test.

4hr lecture on war theory can get dry and boring. Discussions help make it interesting but mostly its just Brenda talking. Taking notes is really important here because it's all you'll have to study from (apart from the readings, of which there is a lot.) Marks kinda hard, and exams are rather tough. OK class overall.

Brenda is one of the best profs at SFU. Her lectures are very informativedense, but, if you take good notes you'll do great. She makes herself available for help during office hours, break, and after class. She even sends you outlines to study from before tests. She's a prof that I check to see if she has a course offering each semester! The best!

She's really kind and leads her students to do the best works they can. Her class would be really hard without a hard effort. However, when she marks essays, she focuses on the contents of the essay rather than how the essay is bullshted. Well, she would like to see how the ideas are clearly presented on the essay, but she enjoys to see your ideas

Great lecturer. Provides lots of examples and tries to engage the students. Very helpful with essays, even makes extra office hours to accommodate everyone. Don't be fooled though. When she says you have a choice of questions, you still really need to know everything because of the way she designs the exams.
Best Prof. in PoliScie department.
Great prof. Caring about her students, and willing to listen. Only downfall talks too fast. If you attend lectures, you don't need the textbook. Paper topics were boring.

She is only makes you right one essay but the topics are dumb for a intro class. Not really a fair marker its her way or the highway. But pretty interesting and she is a good prof and her exams are pretty chill

Brenda is BRILLIANT! She is one of the best profs I've had to date. She really cares for her students and values their opinions/ideas. She is very clear in the way she teaches and very fair marker. Highly recommend taking her classes!
Best poli-sci prof at SFU. Very knowledgable. She cares about her students and wants them to do well/help in any way she can.
she talks so much. goes off in her own world kinda
She's a great professor, one of the best at SFU!
Brenda is a wonderful professor! She explains the material in a way that is easy to understand and the exams are fair! Absolutely would recommend taking a class with her!
Absolutely great!

Awesome teacher. Very knowledgeable and interested in the topic. One of the best profs I've had at SFU. Need to go to class and take lots of notes. She tells you what will be on the tests in a round about way. TAKE A CLASS WITH HER!

I was less thrilled about her than most comments here. She really LOVES her theory, and I don't. If you like classic power theorists and French philosophers this is definitely a good shot, but I found it much too dry. As a person Brenda is great though and will do anything in her power to help students.

TAKE NOTES! She talks a lot but you gotta write it all down that's exactly whats on her exam. She is very helpful if you go talk to her. And she has passion...she can is worth taking a class for. BIGGEST TIP: TAKE NOTES and you will ACE the CLASS
Awesome Prof.  Just do the readings.  If you have any trouble, she will clarify and explain everything for you.  She is super helpful and overall was just a great class.

Brenda was a great prof in my opinion.  Not easy but if you make a fair effort to do the readings you will do fine.  Extremely helpful and is happy to spend time after class to help with concepts, or just to discuss what is on your mind.  Overall I enjoyed her class and would love to take another with her.
Great prof! very easy to talk to and ask questions. She appreciates discussion. If you have any issues with writing your essay, go speak to her; she's very helpful!

Brenda is a great professor. She explains the class material well, there are no surprises on exams. The class was interesting and informative, with a good reading list. Be prepared to work for a good grade.

Great prof. Lectures are clear and interesting. Goes out of her way to help students. but u have to be willing to do the work. Some readings are hard but if u go to class she explains them really well. Also encourages questions and discussion.
Extremely unorganized and unfair prof.  Her marking is extremely subjective.  You really have to make an effort to get in her good books otherwise you have not even an outside shot of doing well

Dr. Lyshaug wants to walk in the heart of darkness but is scared of what is actually there.  That said, she is a wonderful professor and I would highly recommend taking her course.  She lets rambling hippies take over the class too much.  But in this class, there are a lot of those.
Excellent lecture with clarity!Very helpful and lets students raise issues and questions. Too nice to cut off the students. :(
